title: Pompeo Says State Department Has Responded to Congressional Subpoena
summary: Secretary of state faced Friday deadline to turn over documents related to probe. ATHENS-Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said the State Department has sent Congress a letter in response to a subpoena for documents related to the House impeachment inquiry, and said it was clear to him the process was politically motivated.

title: Racetrack Owners Agree to Keep Preakness in Baltimore
summary: Under the plan, Stronach Group would build a new clubhouse at the dilapidated Pimlico Race Course. BALTIMORE-The owners of the historic racetrack that hosts the Preakness Stakes and Baltimore officials have reached an agreement to keep the Triple Crown series' middle jewel in the city.

title: Paris Police Employee Sent Religious Texts Before Knife Attack
summary: The 45-year-old man, who had ties to the Salafist fundamentalist movement of Islam, purchased two knives at nearby store at lunchtime, antiterrorist prosecutor says. PARIS-The police employee who stabbed to death four colleagues in a suspected terrorist attack at Paris police headquarters on Thursday appeared to have calmly planned his assault and been in contact with people tied to the Salafist fundamentalist movement of Islam, France's antiterrorist prosecutor said Saturday.

title: Four Homeless Men Fatally Beaten in New York's Chinatown
summary: A fifth victim was hospitalized in critical condition. Four homeless men were beaten to death in the Chinatown neighborhood of lower Manhattan early Saturday morning by a suspect who was subsequently taken into police custody, New York Police Department officials said.

title: Take the Stage, Mr. President
summary: White House drama keeps coming to Broadway. Ignore all the impeachment drama in Washington. To witness presidential politics in true theatrical form, head straight to Broadway.

title: Boris Johnson's Irish Border Plan Leaves Companies Fretting
summary: The U.K. prime minister's proposal would impose new burdens on companies trading goods across the border between Ireland and Northern Ireland. Boris Johnson's new plan for managing the Irish border after Brexit doesn't appeal to Jonathan Lecky, managing director of Fleming Agri-Products Ltd.

title: Outlet Malls Bucked the Shift to Online. Until Now.
summary: Simon Property bets e-commerce site for outlet stores won't sap foot traffic.

title: What Adult Vapers Should Do Now
summary: As vaping-related illnesses and deaths mount, people who vape-especially those who are using it to quit regular cigarettes-are wondering what their options are. As vaping-related illnesses and deaths mount, adults who vape are asking: What should I do now?

title: Why Cell Service in Subways Is So Terrible
summary: Cash-strapped U.S. cities and modestly motivated carriers struggle to wire up subway tunnels. Hop on the subway in Seoul or Moscow and your smartphone will remain online throughout your journey. Do the same in New York or Washington, D.C., and prepare to go dark in the middle of a tunnel.

title: 'Sui' Generis Fashion
summary: Designer Anna Sui draws inspiration from sources as varied as languorous Pre-Raphaelites, sunny Flower Power, and the Pig-Pen aesthetic of grunge..

title: Has the Big Corporate Unwind Gone Too Far?
summary: Breakups such as the split Emerson Electric is contemplating don't always work out for shareholders. Contrary to the lyrics, breaking up is quite easy to do, at least on Wall Street. But it often leaves investors with long-term heartache.

title: Hong Kong Shuts Down After Night of Violence
summary: Subway remains closed, along with many storefronts and shopping malls, day after government invoked emergency measure. HONG KONG-Citywide disruptions stretched into a second day as Hong Kong's subway network remained closed, along with many storefronts, banks and shopping malls, a day after the government invoked emergency measures to ban masks, prompting a wave of violence overnight.

title: The Race to Zero Commissions
summary: After decades of discounts, the price of trading is suddenly zero with online brokers finding new ways to make money from clients. When Lou Barberini started selling stocks in 1983, his job was to cold-call prospective investors with the chance to get into something hot. His take: $200 in commissions per trade.

title: In Year of Epic Rains, Draining Reservoirs Has Unintended Consequences
summary: Runoff in river basin expected to tie with record year of 2011, putting efforts to get valley ready for next flood season at odds. Federal authorities are racing to drain water from swollen reservoirs on the Upper Missouri River to prepare for next year's flood season, inadvertently complicating efforts to shore up badly damaged levees downstream.

title: Social Security Debate Shifts to Bigger Checks
summary: Center moves as Democrats seek to extend the program's life and expand benefits, while Washington consensus stays out of reach. WASHINGTON-The Social Security debate has moved left.

title: What Matters This Week in the 2020 Race
summary: Impeachment debate overtakes campaign agendas. Former Vice President Joe Biden took the stage at a campaign event in Nevada Wednesday night and declared defiantly: "I'm not going anywhere."

summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Chief U.S. Forester Vicki Christiansen Thinks Some Fires Should Be Left to Burn
summary: The Forest Service's leader faces a growing challenge: ever more American homes built in areas that rely on fire as a natural part of their ecosystems. Only you can prevent forest fires, as the old television ad said, but the nation's top forester wants to let a few burn.

title: How Tim Cook Won Donald Trump's Ear
summary: Resume Subscription. With the threat of tariffs on iPhones approaching in August, Apple Inc. stood to lose billions of dollars in profit. Chief Executive Tim Cook reached out to one of his most important contacts in Washington, Jared Kushner.

title: The Case for Hiring Managers Sight Unseen
summary: The best advice for a company to interview a leadership candidate? Don't.. For three months, I've been examining how companies interview potential managers to try to identify the smartest approach. Today, I'm throwing in the towel.

title: Sanders Suffered Heart Attack
summary: Presidential candidate left hospital Friday afternoon; 'His hospital course was uneventful, with good expected progress,' physicians said. The Sanders campaign said Friday that Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders had a heart attack earlier this week, disclosing more details about the health scare that has temporarily sidelined his presidential bid.

title: Trump Ties Visas to Ability to Pay Health-Care Costs
summary: Move by Trump administration could make it harder for poor migrants to enter the U.S.. WASHINGTON-The White House issued a presidential proclamation on Friday night requiring many future immigrant visa applicants to show they can afford health care, a move that could make it harder for poor migrants to enter the U.S.

title: Sacklers Received as Much as $13 Billion in Profits From Purdue Pharma
summary: The profit amounts are the largest estimate so far of how much the Sacklers made from the maker of OxyContin. OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP sent $12 billion or $13 billion in profits to members of the Sackler family who own the company, according to court records and testimony filed in the drugmaker's bankruptcy case.

summary: Hong Kong to invoke emergency powers, Iraq struggles to contain antigovernment protests, four officers killed at Paris police headquarters, and more. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Venture-Backed IPOs Hit Fundraising Record
summary: Money raised in large listings by Uber and others this year breaks record set during the dot-com boom. Venture-backed companies going public so far this year have raised more money than in any full year on record, including during the dot-com boom.
